titleInfo.title: (PC) McCamey v. California Department of Corrections, et al.,

name.namePart: United States District Court Eastern District of California

titleInfo.title: (PC) McCamey v. California Department of Corrections, et al.,
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Gregory G. Hollows on 3/26/2012 ORDERING that plaintiff's 2, 6 request to proceed IFP is GRANTED; plaintiff to pay the $350.00 filing fee with an initial partial filing fee in accordance with the concurrent CDC order; plaintiff's claims against CDCR, Matthew Cate, and Governor Jerry Brown are DISMISSED with leave to file an amended complaint within 28 days. (Yin, K)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:12-cv-00362; (PC) McCamey v. California Department of Corrections, et al.,;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California

(Yin, K)

titleInfo.title: (PC) McCamey v. California Department of Corrections, et al.,
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER DIRECTING MONTHLY PAYMENTS be made from Prison Account of Royalton McCamey signed by Magistrate Judge Gregory G. Hollows on 3/26/2012. CDC is to collect an initial partial filing fee and thereafter the balance and forward to the clerk until the $350 filing fee is paid in full. Clerk is directed to serve this order and copy of plaintiff's IFP on the Director of CDC. Clerk to also serve Financial with a copy of this order. (cc: CDC, Financial)(Yin, K)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:12-cv-00362; (PC) McCamey v. California Department of Corrections, et al.,;

CDC is to collect an initial partial filing fee and thereafter the balance and forward to the clerk until the $350 filing fee is paid in full. Clerk is directed to serve this order and copy of plaintiff's IFP on the Director of CDC. Clerk to also serve Financial with a copy of this order. (cc: CDC, Financial)(Yin, K)

titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Gregory G. Hollows on 09/24/12 ordering the clerk of the court shall send plaintiff 1 USM-285 form, instruction sheet and a copy of the 2/13/12 complaint to be completed and returned within 60 days from the date of this order. (Plummer, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) McCamey v. California Department of Corrections, et al.,
titleInfo.subTitle: h defendants will have seven days to file any replies.(Dillon, M)ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Allison Claire on 1/4/13 ORDERING that the order of November 26, 2012 (Doc. No. 32) is hereby VACATED; Plaintiffs request for documents (Doc. No. 35) is GRANTED IN PART and DENIED IN PART. The Clerk shall provide plaintiff at his current Yolo County Jail address with a copy of the Complaint (Doc. No. 1) and a copy of the docket in this matter, which are reasonably necessary for plaintiffs preparation of responses to the pending motions; Defendants must re-serve their pending motions to dismiss, originally filed on August 10, 2012 (Doc. No. 14), and on November 20, 2012 (Doc. No. 31), upon plaintiff and file proof of such re- service, within five days of the date of service of this order. The motions must be re-served upon the Yolo County Jail address now noted for plaintiff in the docket of this case. Upon re-service of defendants motions to dismiss, plaintiff will have 28 days to file his oppositions to the motions, after whic

titleInfo.title: (PC) McCamey v. California Department of Corrections, et al.,
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Allison Claire on 1/4/13 ORDERING that the request by the U.S. Marshal for the court to order reimbursement for the costs of personal service upon defendants Lipson, Awatani and Malet, filed on October 31, 2012 26, is DENIED, these defendants having shown good cause for any failure to waive service by mail; and the Clerk of the Court is directed to serve a copy of this order on the U.S. Marshal.(Dillon, M)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:12-cv-00362; (PC) McCamey v. California Department of Corrections, et al.,;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California
extension.docketText: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Allison Claire on 1/4/13 ORDERING that the request by the U.S. Marshal for the court to order reimbursement for the costs of personal service upon defendants Lipson, Awatani and Malet, filed on October 31, 2012 26, is DENIED, these defendants having shown good cause for any failure to waive service by mail; and the Clerk of the Court is directed to serve a copy of this order on the U.S. Marshal.(Dillon, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) McCamey v. California Department of Corrections, et al.,
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Allison Claire on 02/25/13 ordering defendants must re-serve their pending motions to dismiss, originally filed on 08/10/12 14 and on 11/20/12 31, upon plaintiff and file proof of such re-service, within 5 days of the date of service of this order. The motions must be re-served upon plaintiff's residential address in Dixon, California, now noted in the docket of this case. Upon re-service of defendants' motions to dismiss, plaintiff will have 28 days to file his opposition(s) to the motions, after which defendants will have 7 days to file any reply. In addition to serving plaintiff with this order at his Dixon residential address, the clerk of the court is also directed to re-serve, as a courtesy, the returned court orders 36 and 37 upon plaintiff at his Dixon address. (Plummer, M)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:12-cv-00362; (PC) McCamey v. California Department of Corrections, et al.,;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California
extension.docketText: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Allison Claire on 02/25/13 ordering defendants must re-serve their pending motions to dismiss, originally filed on 08/10/12 14 and on 11/20/12 31, upon plaintiff and file proof of such re-service, within 5 days of the date of service of this order. The motions must be re-served upon plaintiff's residential address in Dixon, California, now noted in the docket of this case. Upon re-service of defendants' motions to dismiss, plaintiff will have 28 days to file his opposition(s) to the motions, after which defendants will have 7 days to file any reply. In addition to serving plaintiff with this order at his Dixon residential address, the clerk of the court is also directed to re-serve, as a courtesy, the returned court orders 36 and 37 upon plaintiff at his Dixon address. (Plummer, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) McCamey v. California Department of Corrections, et al.,
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Allison Claire on 3/7/13 ORDERING that Pursuant to plaintiffs request at ECF No. 41, the Clerk of Court shall note in the case docket that defendant Lipson has been voluntarily dismissed pursuant to Rule 41(a)(1)(A)(I); Defendant Lipsons motion to dismiss (ECF No. 14) is vacated from the courts calendar as moot; Proceedings continue as to the motion to dismiss (ECF No. 31) filed on behalf of defendants Malet and Awatami; in accordance with the courts order (ECF No. 39) and defendants (second) re-service at ECF No. 40, plaintiff has until March 26, 2013 to file his opposition, after which defendants have seven days to file a reply.(Dillon, M)

extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California

titleInfo.title: (PC) McCamey v. California Department of Corrections, et al.,
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Allison Claire on 06/04/13 ordering plaintiff must show good cause within 14 days for the failure of service to be effected upon defendant Churby. Plaintiff shall file an opposition, if any, to the motion to dismiss 31 brought by defendants Malet and Awatani within 14 days. There will be no further extension of time for plaintiff to comply with any portion of this order. (Plummer, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) McCamey v. California Department of Corrections, et al.,
titleInfo.subTitle: FINDINGS and RECOMMENDATIONS signed by Magistrate Judge Allison Claire on 6/25/13 RECOMMENDING that Defendant Churby be dismissed from this action pursuant to Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 4(m); This action be dismissed pursuant to Fed. R. of Civ. P. 41(b). Referred to Judge John A. Mendez; Objections to F&R due within 14 days.(Dillon, M)
